desmoj.core.dist

Class Series<O>

  • java.lang.Object
    • desmoj.core.simulator.NamedObject
      • desmoj.core.simulator.ModelComponent
        • desmoj.core.simulator.Reportable
          • desmoj.core.dist.Distribution
            • desmoj.core.dist.Series<O>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SeriesEntities, SeriesNumerical

    public abstract class Series<O>
extends Distribution
    A series is a special distribution returning preset, user-defined entries from a list. Series may be used to simulate certain non-random scenarios within the simulation or to include external sources of (preudo) random distributions

    The internal list can be set to be traversed backwards and/or to repeat once its end has been reached.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Series

        public Series(Model owner,
              java.lang.String name,
              boolean showInReport,
              boolean showInTrace)
        Creates a new Series. Default behaviour when returning samples is - starting at 1st element - reading forward - non-repeating
        Parameters:
        owner - Model : The distribution's owner
        name - java.lang.String : The distribution's name
        showInReport - boolean : Flag for producing reports
        showInTrace - boolean : Flag for producing trace output

        public Reporter createReporter()

        Overrides:
        createReporter in class Distribution
        Returns:
        Reporter : The reporter for the Series
        See Also:

      • setReverse

        public void setReverse(boolean direc)
        Sets the reading direction for the sample list of this series.
        Parameters:
        direc - boolean : true - forward; false - backwards

      • isforward

        public boolean isforward()
        Returns whether this series is getting read forward.

      • setRepeating

        public void setRepeating(boolean repeat)
        Sets whether reading samples from the list is continued from start once the last sample has been returned. If the list is getting read backwards, enabling this will cause the series to start over from the end of the list once the first value has been read.
        Parameters:
        repeat - boolean : Whether this series repeats its value list once the last value has been returned.

      • remove

        public void remove(int position)
        Removes am entry at a certain position out of the sample list, lowering the index of all following entries by one.
        Parameters:
        position - int : The position to remove the value from.

        Removes all entries from the sample list.

        public void set(O element,
                int position)
        Replaces the entry at a certain position with a given entry.
        Parameters:

      • getNumberOfAvailableElements

        public int getNumberOfAvailableElements()
        Returns the amount of samples this series can still return, given the current reading direction and repeating property.
        Returns:
        int : Amount of samples that can be returned before the series reaches its end.

      • sample

        public O sample()
        Returns the next sample from the entry list.
        Returns:
        E : The sample to be returned.

      • sampleObject

        public java.lang.Object sampleObject()
        Convenience method to return the series' sample as Object. For type safety, method sample() should be preferred. However, this method is useful for environments requiring a non-genetic access point to obtain samples from any distribution.
        Specified by:
        sampleObject in class Distribution
        Returns:
        Object : A sample from this this distribution wrapped as Object.
